Explanations about Options.-d(M): Decode (the default behavior is to encode)

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Encode a wav file to flac (this will create a flac file in the same location as the wav file)
Top-3 Scripts:
so_66269365: #!/bin/bash

shopt -s globstar
for f in **/*.flac; do
    flac -cd "$f" | lame -b 320 - "${f%.*}".mp3 # && rm "$f"
done
ul_487024: mkdir mp3 ogg flac; for i in *.wav; do ffmpeg -i "$i" -b:a 320000 "./mp3/${i%.*}.mp3" -b:a 320000 "./ogg/${i%.*}.ogg" "./flac/${i%.*}.flac"; done

Explanations about Options.-acodec(M): Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-i(C): Breakdown: .   "for f in *.flac , *.m4a , *.ogg ;": For every audio file of these types,  "do ffmpeg -i "$f" -ab 320k "${f%.flac}.mp3";": Convert that file to MP3, get the next file.
Explanations about Options.-n(M):
Do not overwrite output files, and exit immediately if a specified output file already
 exists.
Explanations about Options.-vn(M):
As an input option, blocks all video streams of a file from being filtered or being
 automatically selected or mapped for any output. See "-discard" option to disable
 streams individually.

so_17409134: shopt -s globstar
for f in **/*.m4a; do ffmpeg -i "$f" -acodec libmp3lame -ab 320 "${f%.m4a}.mp3"; done
